intro: Diplostephium humile, commonly known as the small diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It has a herbaceous growth habit with simple, alternate leaves. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
